item.title: Tb problem
item.description:
@564654 wrote:

[u]No because if you look… if (teleBlockTimer <= 0)

… That means if its 0, or less… And if no1 is tb’d that means no1 can tele… When someone is tb’d, the teleblocktimer, goes to 80… That means they can tele, and yea, i have a MagicHandler… This is the TB inside it.

if (magicID == 12445) {
p2.teleBlockTimer = 250;
}

Small rlly… But…

item.title: Tb problem
item.description:
@564654 wrote:

Hey, ive been trying to add working TB… And im getting no errors, but its just not working…

For the ‘Teleblock’ method. I have this…

public void Teleblock()
{
teleblock = true;
sendMessage("A teleblock has been cast on you!");
teleBlockTimer = 80;
}

For my teleblock spell, i have this…

if(spellID == 12445) // teleblock (lvl 85 spell)
if(playerLevel[6] >= 85)
{
Teleblock();
inCombat();
PkingDelay = 10;
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
}
else if(playerLevel[6] <= 84)
{
sendMessage("You need a magic level of 85 to cast this spell.");
}

Now this is where its kinda wrong… In my case i added this…

if (teleBlockTimer <= 0)
teleportToX = 3243;
teleportToY = 3522;
sendMessage("Welcome to varrock pking! Go south for banking!");
} else {
sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting!");
}
break;

So the whole case looks like…

case 7318://WildyPort
if (objectX == 3247 && objectY == 3503 || objectX == 3244 && objectY == 3503)
{
if (teleBlockTimer <= 0)
teleportToX = 3243;
teleportToY = 3522;
sendMessage("Welcome to varrock pking! Go south for banking!");
} else {
sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting!");
}
break;

I also tried this, this worked. But this is like perm tb for everyone…

case 7318://WildyPort
if (objectX == 3247 && objectY == 3503 || objectX == 3244 && objectY == 3503)
{
if (teleBlockTimer <= 0)
sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting!");
} else {
teleportToX = 3243;
teleportToY = 3522;
sendMessage("Welcome to Varrock PKING!");
}
break;

Now i realized that wouldn’t work because of <= 0…

Im just really confused :)… Would apreciate if someone can help… Thanks

Read full topic
